alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 08 at 3:08AM CST until February 09 at 8:51PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas, southeast Oklahoma and northeast Texas, including the following counties, in southwest Arkansas, Hempstead, Howard, Little River and Sevier. In southeast Oklahoma, McCurtain. In northeast Texas, Bowie, Camp, Franklin, Morris, Red River and Titus. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Areas of showers and thunderstorms containing potentially heavy rainfall will continue across the area through this evening. Additional rainfall amounts of 1-2 inches with isolated amounts in excess of 3 inches are possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
